intro: Dissanthelium expansum, commonly known as the broadleaf sandreed, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in open, sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces panicles of small, spikelet-like flowers that are often pink to reddish in color. It is characterized by its wide, flat leaves and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides. Dissanthelium expansum is adapted to dry conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
